webhook.step1: Go to Google Cloud Console ‚Üí APIs & Services ‚Üí Enabled APIs & services
webhook.step2: Make sure Google Calendar API is enabled for your project
webhook.step3: In the Domain Verification section, add your domain (premium.gregciupek.com)
webhook.step4: Alternatively: Go to Cloud Domains and verify domain ownership via DNS or HTML file
webhook.step5: After domain verification, click the 'Activate push notifications' button below
webhook.note: Domain verification in Google Cloud Console is required to receive push notifications. Without it, synchronization will only work manually (via the 'Sync Now' button).

instructions.title: Installation Instructions
instructions.importance_text: CRON is responsible for automatically sending emails from the queue, processing schedules, and maintenance operations. Without proper CRON configuration, scheduled messages will not be sent.
instructions.docker_text: In a Docker environment, the scheduler is started automatically when the containers are active.
instructions.linux_text: Add an entry to crontab with the command {command}:
instructions.linux_warning: Replace {path} with the actual path to your application directory.
instructions.automation_text: You can run CRON from external automation tools via {bold}. Simply call the endpoint every minute.
instructions.forge_text: Laravel Forge: The scheduler is automatically configured for every Laravel application. Simply enable the "Schedule" option in the server panel.
instructions.vapor_text: Laravel Vapor: The scheduler is built into the serverless environment and works automatically.
instructions.n8n_note: Use the {node} node with a {trigger} trigger every minute.
instructions.make_note: Use the {module} module with scheduling set to every minute.

webhook.no_token: Generate an API token to use the webhook.

verification.step2: In the "Statistics" tab, run data will appear
verification.step3: In the "History" tab, you will see execution logs
verification.step4: On the Dashboard, a widget with the CRON status will appear

mcp.agent_prompt_description: Copy this prompt to your AI agent so it can effectively use NetSendo MCP. The prompt contains usage instructions, available tools list, and examples.
mcp.agent_prompt_content:
You are an AI assistant with access to NetSendo ‚Äî an email/SMS marketing platform.

AVAILABLE TOOLS:
- list_subscribers, get_subscriber, create_subscriber, update_subscriber, delete_subscriber
- list_contact_lists, list_tags, sync_subscriber_tags
- list_campaigns, get_campaign, create_campaign, update_campaign, send_campaign
- set_campaign_lists, set_campaign_exclusions, schedule_campaign, get_campaign_stats
- list_ab_tests, create_ab_test, add_ab_variant, start_ab_test, end_ab_test
- list_funnels, get_funnel, create_funnel, add_funnel_step, activate_funnel
- send_email, send_sms
- list_placeholders, test_connection, get_account_info

PLACEHOLDERS IN CONTENT:
- [[first_name]], [[last_name]], [[email]], [[phone]] - subscriber data
- [[!fname]] - first name in vocative case (Polish)
- [[unsubscribe_link]] - REQUIRED in every email
- [[manage]] - manage preferences link
- {'{'}{'{'}male|female{'}'}{'}'} - gender variation

CAMPAIGN WORKFLOW:
1. create_campaign ‚Üí 2. set_campaign_lists ‚Üí 3. send_campaign

IMPORTANT:
- Always use list_placeholders first to learn available placeholders
- Every email MUST contain [[unsubscribe_link]]
- Before sending a campaign you MUST assign lists (set_campaign_lists)

guide.title: User Guide
guide.subtitle: Learn how to use CRM effectively for sales success
guide.footer: Need more help? Contact support or check the documentation.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.p1: Welcome to the Sales CRM! This powerful module helps you manage your entire sales process - from lead generation to closing deals.
intro.feature3: Task management with Google Calendar sync
intro.feature5: CSV import for bulk data upload

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.p1: The CRM Dashboard gives you a quick overview of your sales performance and pending activities.
dashboard.widget1_desc: View total contacts, open deals, won deals this month, and pending tasks at a glance.
dashboard.widget2_desc: See tasks that need immediate attention - highlighted in red for priority.
dashboard.widget3_desc: Your highest-scoring leads that are most likely to convert.
dashboard.widget4_desc: Your scheduled activities for today - calls, meetings, and follow-ups.

contacts.title: Managing Contacts
contacts.p1: Contacts are the heart of your CRM. Each contact represents a person you're doing business with.
contacts.step1: Click 'Create Contact' button in the top right
contacts.step2: Fill in email (required), name, phone, and other details
contacts.step4: Set the initial status (Lead, Prospect, etc.)
contacts.step5: Save - the contact is now ready for follow-up!
contacts.tip_text: Use filters to quickly find contacts by status, company, or owner. You can also search by name or email.

companies.title: Companies
companies.p1: Companies help you organize contacts by organization. Link multiple contacts to a single company for B2B sales.
companies.field4: Tax ID (NIP) and REGON for Polish companies
companies.lookup_text: Enter NIP or REGON and click 'Fetch data' to automatically fill company information from the REGON database.

deals.title: Deals Pipeline
deals.p1: The Deals view shows your sales pipeline as a Kanban board. Drag deals between stages to track progress.
deals.step1: Click 'New Deal' to create a sales opportunity
deals.step2: Set the deal value, currency, and expected close date
deals.step3: Link to a contact and/or company
deals.step4: Drag the deal card to move it through stages
deals.step5: Move to 'Won' when closed, or 'Lost' if unsuccessful

tasks.title: Tasks
tasks.p1: Tasks help you stay organized with follow-ups, calls, meetings, and other activities.
tasks.calendar_text: Connect your Google Calendar in Settings ‚Üí Integrations to automatically sync tasks. Enable 'Sync to Google Calendar' when creating a task to see it in your calendar.
tasks.recurring_text: Enable 'Recurring Task' to automatically create follow-up tasks on a schedule - daily, weekly, monthly, or custom intervals.

sequences.title: Follow-up Sequences
sequences.p1: Sequences automate your follow-up process. Define a series of tasks that are automatically created based on triggers.
sequences.trigger2_desc: When a new contact is added
sequences.trigger3_desc: When a new deal is created
sequences.trigger4_desc: When any task is marked complete
sequences.trigger5_desc: When a deal moves to a new stage

import.title: Importing Data
import.p1: Import contacts in bulk from a CSV file. This is perfect for migrating from another CRM or adding a large list.
import.step1: Prepare your CSV file with headers (email is required)
import.step2: Upload the file - we'll auto-detect columns
import.step3: Map your CSV columns to CRM fields
import.step4: Choose how to handle duplicates (skip or update)

tips.title: Best Practices
tips.p1: Follow these practices to maximize your sales effectiveness with the CRM.
tips.workflow1: Start with Dashboard - check overdue tasks and hot leads
tips.workflow3: Update deal stages based on progress
tips.workflow4: Review upcoming tasks and prepare for tomorrow
tips.workflow5: End the day with 0 overdue tasks!
